llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: field_suggestions", "detection": "potential", "category": "Unknown", "description": "The GraphQL server returns suggestion text that reveals valid field names on types (e.g., amount, description, firstName, lastName, name). This is an information-disclosure vulnerability commonly called field_suggestions: error messages expose schema details that an attacker can use for automated reconnaissance and schema/field enumeration. Although not an immediate data-exfiltration bug, it lowers the effort required to craft targeted queries and can facilitate further attacks. Recommend suppressing or sanitizing server error messages (disable suggestion output in the GraphQL library/config, return generic validation errors, or implement a custom formatError) to avoid leaking schema details.", "evidence": "Error messages in response: \"Cannot query field \\\"amont\\\" on type \\\"Transaction\\\". Did you mean \\\"name\\\"?\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL server returns suggestion text that reveals valid field names on types (e.g., amount, description, firstName, lastName, name). This is an information-disclosure vulnerability commonly called field_suggestions: error messages expose schema details that an attacker can use for automated reconnaissance and schema/field enumeration. Although not an immediate data-exfiltration bug, it lowers the effort required to craft targeted queries and can facilitate further attacks. Recommend suppressing or sanitizing server error messages (disable suggestion output in the GraphQL library/config, return generic validation errors, or implement a custom formatError) to avoid leaking schema details."}}]
